item.title: Immigration officers assert sweeping power to enter homes without a judgeâ€™s warrant, memo says
item.description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement memo obtained by The Associated Press reveals that the agency allows immigration officers to forcibly enter homes to make arrests without a judicial warrant.

item.title: Immigration enforcement arrives in Maine as a court freezes restrictions on tactics in Minnesota
Homicide rate declines sharply in dozens of US cities, a new report shows
